definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
Hong Kong Basic Law (in effect since the resumption of Chinese sovereignty in 1997)

sentences.english: The legislative intent of the Basic Law was clear and there was no need for an interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 基本法的立法原意明确，故无须释法。

sentences.english: Germany guarantees “the right of personality” in its Basic Law.
sentences.chinese: 德国的基本法保障“人格权”。

sentences.english: Once a member of the Standing Committee of the Consultative Committee for the Basic Law of MSAR.
sentences.chinese: 曾任澳门基本法咨询委员会常务委员。

sentences.english: Second, it is important to strictly comply with the Basic Law.
sentences.chinese: 第二，坚持严格按照基本法办事。

sentences.english: A two-year term was consistent with the Basic Law's legislative intent.
sentences.chinese: 两年任期符合基本法的立法原意。

sentences.english: That basic law is the most powerful guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 这个基本法就是最有利的保证。

sentences.english: The Basic Law guarantees that the power of final adjudication is kept in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 《基本法》承诺，香港的终审权由香港人负责行使。

sentences.english: Civil law is the basic law of a civil society, and its essential concept is the inviolability of civil rights.
sentences.chinese: 民法作为市民社会的基本法，其基本观念是私权神圣。

sentences.english: He said this meant that “the basic political system should be kept.
sentences.chinese: 他说的意思是“基本法体系应该被遵守。

sentences.english: According to the Basic Law of the Special Administrative Region, Hong Kong will enjoy a high degree of autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 根据特别行政区的基本法，香港将享有高度自治。

sentences.english: The surge in unemployment rate and the legislation of Article 23 are now in the limelight.
sentences.chinese: 失业率急升和基本法二十三条立法已经成为新的焦点。

definition: Hong Kong Basic Law (in effect since the resumption of Chinese sovereignty in 1997)
system of constitutional government/(used as an attributive) constitutional
one country, two systems (PRC proposal regarding Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan)
International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR)

definition: anti-secession law of 2005 (whereby PRC claims the right to invade Taiwan)
